jobs.title: Junior Business Developer
jobs.description:
Join the revolution with Leavy.co


If you want to be part of a growing start-up, this job is for you. Leavy.co is a travel platform who wants to transform the market. To do so we need properties and this is where you will help us grow.


We are looking for a passionate individual who wants to initiate their career and put their knowledge in practice. As you might know, start-ups are a very fun and dynamic place to work and therefore we are looking for someone who wants to work in this kind of environment.


The main job is to attract and look after new “happy leavers” who are property owner or tenants that want to leave their properties for our community of travellers. This position also covers other parts of the business as account management and marketing strategies.


Your main duties will be:


Building a long-lasting portfolio of new landlords and tenants (happy leavers).
Initiating and taking full responsibility from prospecting to closing sales cycle efficiently: phone call, meet lead and closing the deal.
Thinking alongside clients to find optimal solutions that are the best fit for the customer’s strategy.
Understanding the clients’ needs and translate them into commercial solutions.
Collaborate with other teams to improve the development of our tools, our marketing and our customer service.
Analyze the market to identify new opportunities.
Lead generation.
Being the face of the organisation.
Weekly reporting to the management in Rome.

What we are looking for:


Strong desire to improve and learn.
Great listener and communicator.
Ability to create reports with different personas.
Autonomous worker.
Target driven.
Fluent in Italian and good in English.
Passion to work in a fast paced environment.
Embrace our company culture: Resilience, Diversity Matters, Brutal Honesty and GO BIG OR GO HOME!
Student or Graduated in Business Administration, Economics or related field preferred.

jobs.title: Senior VP Logistics
jobs.description:
Leavy.co is aiming to become a leading online travel platform where you can live the ultimate travel experience in a few clicks.

Start-up originated in Paris, quickly expanding into other countries. We are building a community and we need your help.

Leavy has offices in Paris, London, Rome, Madrid, Lisbon and Amsterdam. 

We are currently structuring our Global Operations organization and seeking a leader to settle smooth and cost-optimal logistics processes and help in their local implementation ! 

In this role, you will be a key driver of the success of our expansion and profitability by supporting the local country management and building a strong relevant logistics process from the HQs that every city can use.


Job description :
- Develop long-range field objectives and strategies for every city where Leavy is or aiming to be
- Monitor performance against these objectives and provide feedback to direct reports and team members
- Create and maintain standard operating procedures and best practices in terms of performance monitoring in order to optimize costs while keeping a high-end quality service 
- Strategic planning and execution to enhance profitability, productivity and efficiency throughout the company’s operations.
- Define information systems requirements to support process improvement initiatives.
- Integrate the technology, quality, purchasing, and logistics functions to support product and process excellence.
- Provides leadership, coaching, supports, motivates, directs and trains high-caliber staff.
- Develop and implement ongoing staff performance.
- Achieve world-class supply chain, warehousing, forward and reverse logistics operations.
- Promotes “total customer satisfaction” (delivery, quality, etc.) within all Operations teams.
- Continually benchmark and introduce process improvement measures and present suggestions to COO for consideration.
- Develop and manage annual operating budget.
- Build an open and honest communication line within the organization.
- Interact regularly with executive team and individual department heads to ensure the company’s operational priorities are aligned with total company direction.
- Prepare and submit monthly reporting.

Qualifications
- B.S. in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management or other related degree required.
- 5-10 years’ experience in an Ops startup with high level position and a proven track record, specific to distribution.
- Have already managed and coached people.
- Experience with implementation of large scale automation projects.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
- Resilient, honest with a well structured mind
- A positive, can-do spirit, open to new ideas and change.
- A systems thinking approach, coupled with an innate sense of quantitative thinking and data-driven decision making.
- Demonstrated ability in driving change leadership.
- Experience in a complex, domestic and global growing startup/company.
- Strategic thinker with excellent analytical and communication skills.
- Knowledge of supply chain sustainability.

jobs.title: Senior Vice President Of Customer Success
jobs.description:
About The Company :

Founded in 2017, Leavy.co is on a mission to build the largest travel community! 
We are a fast growing travel tech company that went from 1 to +100 employees in just 1 year. Today, we have offices in 6 major European travel capitals.  
And are growing at light speed. 

So if you are looking for a super challenging experience, look no further ! 

About The Position :

We are looking for an enthusiastic Senior Vice President Of Customer Success. 
In this position you will directly be reporting to the COO. 

Your main missions are : 

* Creation of scalable content
* Business process management
* Team structuring & talent development
* Internal communication with our international offices 

As an SVP of CS you will furthermore be responsible for : 

* Develop an understanding of the clients needs and position yourself as an advisor delivering "Best Practices",
* Build a team that will educate and train customers about setup, functionalities and best practices. This includes the creation of the App's FAQ, 
* Deliver internal presentations so to train your workforce,
* Cross-departmental collaboration with Leavy’s different departments, including : Sales, Operations, Data, Tech, Product, Marketing, Logistics,
* Be accountable for the budget management of your department.

Requirements Are :

* +5 years Experience in a similar role
* French and English bilingual
* Previous experience with CS Softwares (eg. Zendesk, SalesForce) 
* Msc is required, MBA is a strong plus
* International mobility is a must
* Previous experience in the Startup ecosystem is highly appreciated

Why joining us :

* Located in central Paris: Hotel de Ville
* Amazing offices: we have a beach... yes a real beach in our offices
* Incredible career progression opportunities
* The chance to become part of a truly multicultural and dynamic team

jobs.title: Short-lets Assistant
jobs.description:
Become a Host on Demand!

Do you love London and it’s fabulous properties?

Do you enjoy communicating and meeting new people?

What about getting paid to do this?

Leavy is a startup who rewards its community.

With teams in 6 of the biggest European cities, we offer our Happy Leavers (property owners) a guaranteed income while they are away.

Join the Leavy community and get paid to help us manage a property as if it was your own place.

You will have a lot of responsibility and will need to ensure the property and guests are looked after before, during and after each reservation.

This will include:

   Managing communication with guests before, during and after their stay;
   Plan every check-in and check-out with guests;
   Go personally to each check-in so you can guide guests around the property; 
   Go to the property promptly after each check-out to clean and prepare the property for the next guests;
   Wash, dry and prepare the linen inbetween reservations; 
   Ensure the property is in good condition before the next guest;
   Communicate any issues with the property or guests to your support team at Leavy;
   Helping to correct general wear and tear, for example, replacing lightbulbs.

Profile :

  You live in the city, you love to meet new people and share all your city’s secrets.
   You like to be free and to organize your day by yourself.
   You are addicted to your smartphone, quick to reply and happy to speak to different people.

Beginning : ASAP
Status: Contractor (freelancer)

Benefits:

  Work from home opportunities
  Lots of responsibility
  A valued member of our community
  A support team available to help you day-to-day
  Flexible working hours
  Get paid for each reservation that you manage, this could be £800/month/property!

Job Types: Full-time, Contract
